message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $10,000. It's a great deal for you, considering its value to you is $8,000.  Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8,500. I'm willing to pay a premium for the product, but I need to stay within my budget. Can you meet me halfway?

Bob, I understand your budget constraints, but $8,500 is simply too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $9,500. This is a fair price considering the value of the product to you. Let's see if we can find common ground.
I understand your perspective, but $9,500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $9,000. Can you consider this price?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $9,000 is still a little low. I'm willing to come down to $9,250. This is a fair price that balances both our needs. I'm confident this is a good deal for both of us.

I understand your persistence, but $9,250 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer $9,100. This is the best I can do, and I hope you can meet me halfway again.
Bob, I understand that we're getting close to a deal. I'm willing to go down to $9,150 for this product. This is my final offer, and I hope you'll accept it. This will give us both a good deal.

I appreciate your persistence, but $9,150 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer $9,000. This is the absolute maximum I can pay, and I hope you can meet me at this price.
